sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management

tag.narrative: 10.3 - Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

10.3 - Säkerställa lika möjligheter och minska förekomsten av ojämlika utfall, bland annat genom att avskaffa diskriminerande lagstiftning, politik och praxis och främja lagstiftning, politik och åtgärder av lämpligt slag i detta hänseende.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

title.narrative: Amendment to the Grant agreement Sida AGE

description.narrative: The cooperation with the two partners has worked generally well, although it started very slow. There has been some insecurity on the side of AGE related to the format and content of agreed reporting. After arrival of the long term consultant in 2016 contracted by Niras the work and the process improved. Intermediate Result 1. Gender equality objectives are prioritized and further introduced and gradually integrated into policy and legal frameworks, and systems. Overview of Intermediate Result 1 To achieve the accomplishment of the intermediate result (1), four outputs were identified and expected to be delivered during the project life-cycle: Output 1.1.1 AGE and Gender Equality Officers (GEO)s practice gender mainstreaming and analysis in policy making processes Output 1.1.2 Increased coordination of AGE with Legal Office and the Secretariat at the Office of the Prime minister to support gender mainstreaming processes and their implementation into policies and normative acts. Output 1.1.3 Kosovo line ministries and municipalities have improved methodology on gender data gathering and reporting. Output 1.1.4 Gender rEsponsive Budgeting (GRB) is initiated and piloted to selected Kosovo central and local level institutions. Summary of Activities Undertaken: Introduction of Gender Equality Impact Assessment: Manual on the Implementation of Gender Equality Impact Assessment(GEIA), 12 two-day training sessions, 11 orientations sessions, 45 working groups drafting regulatory concept notes trained on GEIA , one study visits, Partial Ex-post of Law on Gender Equality, Manual on Monitoring Framework of the Law on Gender Equality Implementation, TOR on the LGE Monitoring and Reporting Information Management System, Training Plan Document for the Implementation of the Manual on Monitoring Framework of the Law on Gender Equality Implementation, Informative Package on What Shall We Know on Kosovo Gender Equality, two seminars, development of the Kosovo Program for Gender Equality, Manual for the Integrated Annual Planning System for AGE and Gender Mechanisms, two workshops, 45 gender equality officers and AGE staff trained on the drafting effective annual work plan document. Draft Concept Note on the Gender Budgeting in Kosovo, two study visits. Intermediate Result 2. Partnership and networking platforms contribute to the institutional strengthening of gender mechanism, inform policies and effective coordination system. Overview of Intermediate Result 2 To achieve the accomplishment of the intermediate result (2), the following outputs were identified and expected to be delivered during the project life-cycle: Output 2.1.1 AGE develops partnership for professional development and policy tools in the following areas: gender statistics and institutional strengthening. Output 2.1.2 AGE develops partnership with academia to access expertise and improve gender mainstreaming. Output 2.1.3 AGE establishes and leads at least two national networks with participation of CSOs and other partners. Summary of Activities Undertaken: Support to AGE and Agency of Statistics for the development of Kosovo Gender Equality Index, training of the working group working on the data calculation for the production of Gender Equality Index, Development of Gender and Economics syllabus and its approval as a taught course in the School of Economics of Prishtina University (UP), Seminar on gender and economics and gender mainstreaming in the tertiary education with students and faculty staff of the School of Economics of Prishtina University, Purchasing of several book titles for the creation of mini-library on gender and economics and as part of the literature required by the syllabus. Obtaining of the publishing right for the main textbook of the Gender and Economics syllabus and its translation in Kosovo’s official language. Linkages established between School of Economics of UP and the Institute for Social Studies of the Hague University for future partnership development on knowledge sharing and expertise on gender mainstreaming in academia and field of economic studies. Development of the Manual for Preventing Gender Stereotypes and Promoting Gender Equality in School Textbooks. The manual aims to assist textbook reviewers, and not only, during the review process of textbooks, covering grade 1 to 12 of the pre-university school system. Seminar with policy makers of Ministry of Education, Science and technology, CSOs representatives, school directors and teachers, Kosovo gender mechanisms on the use and benefits of the Manual. Intermediate Result 3. Gender equality is publicly promoted and gender stereotypes are addressed. Overview of Intermediate Result 3 To achieve the accomplishment of the intermediate result (3), the following outputs were identified and expected to be delivered during the project life-cycle: Output 3.1.1 AGE develops and implements a four-year communication strategy for promoting the Kosovo gender equality agenda to Kosovo public. Output 3.1.2 AGE’s capacities to monitor and counteract media gender stereotypes enhanced. Summary of Activities Undertaken: Development of a Four-Year of Communication Strategy of AGE on communicating Gender Equality Agenda of Kosovo. Three trainings on gender and media with public information officers in line ministries and municipalities, advertising firms and one seminar with students of journalism from the School of Journalism from Prishtina University. One research on Gender Representation on Print Media in Kosovo. Two round tables with journalists and students of journalism presenting the results of Gender Representation on Print Media in Kosovo. Established AGE Resource Center with gender literature covering diverse studying areas. Please see Exit Plan-AGE under the folder Niras \\PRISTI-EM-FS-01\Shared\Common\REFORM COOPERATION\8. RA2 STRENGTHENED DEMOCRACY\Civil Society\AGE\Niras\5. Narrative and Financial report as per the Agreement\2020
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
